snippet: CAIRO - The police in several Egyptian cities on Thursday night and early Friday battled thousands of die-hard soccer fans angry at the government's failure to prevent more than 70 deaths at a soccer riot. Two protesters were killed by police gunfire...
abstract: CAIRO - The police in several Egyptian cities on Thursday night and early Friday battled thousands of die-hard soccer fans angry at the government's failure to prevent more than 70 deaths at a soccer riot. Two protesters were killed by police gunfire in Suez, while in Cairo more than 600 were injured by tear gas and stampeding crowds.
lead_paragraph: CAIRO - The police in several Egyptian cities on Thursday night and early Friday battled thousands of die-hard soccer fans angry at the government's failure to prevent more than 70 deaths at a soccer riot. Two protesters were killed by police gunfire in Suez, while in Cairo more than 600 were injured by tear gas and stampeding crowds.

headline.main: Police Kill 2 Protesters as Egyptians Unleash Fury Over Soccer Riot Deaths
